content.description: Cool route on the south face of Slanderland.  Start in downward pulling flake and go straight up using the sidepull flake and lieback.  The business ends low but it stays on you up high.
content.location: Left route on the south face of the rock.  Look for a stained round shaped recess with a flake to its left.  Start just below this.

content.description: Fun starting moves in a cool location on almost vertical terrain lead to a good 2 or 3 finger pocket ( crux is around here ), then finish with committing but easier moves up the lower angle face above. There is a small tree at the base of the climb that might not be fun to fall into from up high !!
content.location: Left of center on the north (north east) face of the Slanderland boulder. Look for an obvious and inticing 2 of 3 finger pocket just below the midway point with a small tree at the base of the route. NOTE : This is the downclimb so learn to reverse the moves !!

content.description:
Yes, it's a lead.

Up and diagonal right on thin moves to the 1st bolt, now boldly up to bolt 2, and then easier ground.
content.protection: 2 bolts, one old (#1) and one new (#2 placed by Tony Tennessee and Mike Newheart).
content.location: Right edge of the north side of the boulder
